CONJUGATES: plural: honeys | verb: honeys, honeying, honied
ETYMOLOGY: From Old English 'hunig', from Proto-Germanic '*hunagam', ultimately from Proto-Indo-European '*k(e)nh₂-' ('yellow, golden, brown').

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun. A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). This usage is typically uncountable.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A sweet, viscous food substance produced by honeybees and some other insects, composed primarily of sugars and water.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一种由蜜蜂和其他一些昆虫生产的甜味、粘稠的食物，主要由糖和水组成。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: She stirred a spoonful of honey into her tea.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她将一勺蜂蜜搅入茶中。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Noun. A word (other than a pronoun) used to identify any of a class of people, places, or things (common noun), or to name a particular one of these (proper noun). This usage is often countable.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: A term of endearment, often used to address a beloved person.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 一个亲昵的称呼，常用来称呼所爱的人。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Can you pass me the remote, honey?
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 亲爱的，你能把遥控器递给我吗？

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Adjective. A word or phrase naming an attribute, added to or grammatically related to a noun to modify or describe it.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: Having a yellowish-brown color, similar to that of honey.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 呈黄褐色，类似于蜂蜜的颜色。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: Her hair was a beautiful honey blonde.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 她的头发是美丽的蜜糖金。

MEANINGS.POS_TIP: Transitive verb (vtr): A verb that takes one or more objects. Intransitive verb (vintr): A verb that does not take a direct object.
MEANINGS.DEF_EN: To make sweet or agreeable; to flatter or coax.
MEANINGS.DEF_ZH: 使甜美或顺耳；奉承或哄骗。
MEANINGS.SENT_EN: He tried to honey his words to win her over.
MEANINGS.SENT_ZH: 他试图甜言蜜语来赢得她的芳心。
